alert.note: Alert for Vinton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 1:32AM EDT until March 27 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following counties, Athens and Vinton. * WHEN...Until 615 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 130 AM EDT, Streams continue to be high from previous flooding, causing water on some roadways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Athens, Nelsonville, Mcarthur, Albany, Lake Hope State Park, Chauncey, Buchtel, Zaleski, Amesville, The Plains, Creola, Stroud Run State Park, Allensville and Eagle Mills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
